title: Derivative of a composite function with a graph

content.question: The graph of the function f, consisting of two line segments, is shown in the figure above. Let g be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E01@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and let h be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40D0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>h</mi> <mo>â€²</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3970@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

topic.text: 2.6: Derivative Rules - Constant, Sum, Difference, and Constant Multiple

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
